The National Arts Theatre is the primary centre for the performing arts in Nigeria. The monument is located in Iganmu, Surulere, Lagos. Its construction was completed in 1976 in preparation for the Festival of Arts and Culture (FESTAC) in 1977.map location(geo:6.476389,3.369444).

The entrance to the Tafawa Balewa Square(TBS) has gigantic sculptures of four white horses hovering above the gate and seven red eagles, which are symbols from the national emblem signifying Strength and Dignity respectively. (map location: 6.445751, 3.401547)

In the heart of Lagos State,the amusement Park is a place filled with so much fun and joy that everybody wants to visit. If not for engaging games but for the opportunity to free one\'s self of all the bonds and stress of work and at the same time spend quality time with the family. 6.443481, 3.368001

The original Banana Island construction project entitled Lagoon City was the brainchild of the Late Chief Adebayo Adeleke, a University of London trained Civil Engineer (MICE), and CEO of City Property Development Ltd.
Elegushi Beach is a private beach located at Lekki, Lagos state, South west of Nigeria. The beach is owned by the Elegushi royal family in Lekki, Lagos state. 6.421878, 3.485918

Freedom Park is a memorial and leisure park area in the middle of downtown Lagos in Lagos Island, Nigeria which was formerly Her Majesty\'s Broad Street Prison. It was designed by the Architect Theo Lawson.

The Lekki Conservation centre was established in 1990 to serve as biodiversitynconservation icon and environment education centre. The facility was built by the Chevron Corporation for the Nigerian Conservation Foundation (NCF), as a reserved sanctuary for the rich flora and fauna of the Lekki Peninsula.

The Silverbird Cinema is one of the biggest cinemas in West Africa with 69 screens in branches across Nigeria, Accra and Nairobi.
The first cinema was opened in May 2004 at the Silverbird Galleria in Victoria Island, Lagos. Massive commercial success has given rise to the opening of additional multiplexes in different locations across Nigeria

Ozone Cinemas is located within e-Centre Mall in Yaba Lagos. Ozone is a four-screen multiplex cinema with 619 luxury seats. It is also owned and run by the promoters of Silverbird Cinemas. They constantly show current movies and it’s an exciting place especially for younger viewers.

Genesis Deluxe Cinemas is one of Nigeria’s leading operators of multiplex cinemas in Nigeria. The company started in Lagos in 2008, today, it has grown into a household name with 7 cinemas with 28 screens and over 4000 seats. Genesis Cinemas has cinemas located in Lagos, Port-Harcourt, Warri, Owerri, and Abuja

Filmhouse Cinemas Limited is a dynamic film exhibition company with a vision to be the no.1 cinema brand in Nigeria. We are currently implementing a strategic development plan to roll-out twenty five (25) cinemas over a six (6) year period that commenced in December, 2012.

Marturion Cinemas Limited is an exhibitor of cinema content, dedicated to giving our guests a great cinematic experience at all times. Marturion Cinemas is part of the Marturion Group, dedicated to the creation, distribution and exhibition of entertainment content across all consumer bases in Nigeria and beyond.
Dos Lagos 15 is a state of the art movie theater featuring all stadium seating, all digital projection, digital surround sound, digital 3-d great concession items and a terrific location.
